activities: Symantec collects Personal Information from Employees and from Prospective Employees such as name, work and personal contact information, education, professional experience, gender, country of citizenship, date of birth, payroll data, compensation, management records, and system and application access data.  We process Employee Personal Information as necessary to fulfill our legal obligations, or as appropriate to perform human resources management, business and financial management of Symantec and its affiliated entities. In particular, we collect and use information to establish and perform the employment contract, to enable employees to perform their job, to conduct Symantec’s business, to protect our legitimate interests, and to comply with legal requirements.
contactoff1: Privacy Program Office - Legal & Public Affairs
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Off-line, On-line, Manually processed human resources data
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities; Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner of Switzerland
